Dear Mack McGhee:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

Sincerely,

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Rules compliance
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4104
Section (2) After being licensed, an institution shall, on an ongoing basis,
Description comply with the act, child caring institution rules, and terms of the
license.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It was reported today that the facility has a census of 123 youth,
and their licensing terms only allows for 120 youth.
Investigation Documentation
Wayne County Juvenile Detention Center (WCJDC)
CE821001676 timeline regarding youth capacity from 08/26/2024
to 09/19/2024.
• 08/26/2024 Department of Child Welfare Licensing (DCWL)
issued WCJDC a six-month original license for 120 youths
ages 12 to 17 years old. (WCJDC has bed space capacity
for 160 youths.)
• 09/04/2024 WCJDC Chief Administrator notified DCWL by
email at 10:59 AM that WCJDC had 123 youths in care but
anticipated several releases. DCWL confirmed with WCDC
that 122 youths remained in care at 5:00 PM.
• 09/06/2024 DCWL Supervisor notified WCJDC that an
investigation is underway about being over their licensed
capacity.
• 09/17/2024 DCWL Director provided WCJDC the Child
Caring Institution application for a change in capacity and
provided the recommendation of changing their capacity to
130 youths for ages 12 to 17 years old.
• 09/18/2024 WCJDC Chief Administrator submitted the
Child Caring Institution application with a change request to
increase their capacity to 130 youths for ages 12 to 17
years old.
• 09/19/2024 DCWL issued WCJDC an amended Original
Licensing report stating WCJDC has a capacity of 130
youths for ages12 to 17 years old.
Interviews
Deputy Director was interviewed on 10/10/2024 at WCJDC. He
stated 117 youths were in care on this date. Deputy Director was
2

interviewed again on 10/23/2024 at WCJDC and stated 102
youths were in care on this date.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance in following the terms of
their license on 09/04/2024 when WCJDC exceeded their licensed
capacity of 120 youths. WCJDC capacity was changed to 130
youths on 09/19/2024.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
• WCJDC is to submit a Child Caring Institution application to
DCWL when nearing their licensed capacity.
• WCJDC is to submit a variance request to DCWL prior to
placement of a youth outside their licensed age range.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Rule Code Staff to resident ratio
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4127
Section (1) The licensee shall develop and adhere to a written staff to
Description resident ratio formula for direct care workers.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Wayne County Juvenile Detention is short staffed.
Investigation Interviews
Deputy Director was interviewed on 10/10/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention Center (WCJDC). He stated WCJDC continues
to review staffing needs and hire staff as needed. Deputy Director
stated WCJDC staff to resident ratio is 1:8 during waking hours to
comply with the Prison Rape Elimination Act.
Documentation
WCJDC staffing concern timeline.
• 09/11/2024 Received email from an anonymous staff.
Email stated there is a staffing shortage at WCJDC and
hiring will not start until 10/2024.
• 09/16/2024 Email sent to anonymous staff requesting
information.
• 09/20/2024 Email received from anonymous staff stating
WCJDC took steps to increase staffing. Anonymous staff
stated he or she will reach out with specific incidents of
3

staffing shortages moving forward, but did not have specific
dates for this investigation.
• 09/05/2024 and 09/10/2024 WCJDC Daily Assignment
sheets were randomly picked for review. 09/05/2024
staffing for midnight, morning and afternoon shifts met staff
to youth ratio requirements per unit, counting the use of
utility staff (extra staff) on each shift. 09/10/2024 midnight
shift met staff to youth ratio requirements per unit. Morning
shift Unit 1A had one staff for thirteen youths and Unit 3B
had one staff for nine youths, which are not in compliance
with the minimum of one staff to eight youth ratio required
for these units during waking hours. There were zero
morning shift utility staff to assist in staffing. Afternoon shift
Unit 2B had one staff for eleven youths, which is not in
compliance with the minimum of one staff to eight youths
required for this unit during waking hours. There were two
afternoon shift utility staff who worked until 5:30 PM, which
caused a lack of staff coverage for Unit 2B from 5:30 PM to
11:00 PM through the use of utility staff.
• Wayne County Juvenile Detention Pod Staffing and
Management – 10.10 policy and procedure received on
09/24/2024 does not state the correct staff to resident ratio
as previously reviewed and approved by Department of
Child Welfare Licensing and as stated by Deputy Director.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance of maintaining the required
staff to youth ratio on 09/10/2024 Unit 1A and Unit 3B morning
shift and Unit 2B afternoon shift.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Revise staff to resident ratio in Pod Staffing and Management –
10.10 policy and procedure and submit to Department of Child
Welfare Licensing. Also, review issue date, effective date, and
amendment date of this policy and procedure and revise
accordingly. If an incorrect copy of this policy and procedure was
sent, please forward the correct version.
CONSULTATION
Supervisors, managers and directors (if trained in restraint) are
able to provide emergency staff coverage for youth supervision
and count in the staff to youth ratio for compliance. The name of
the supervisor, manager or director is to be listed on Daily
Assignment Sheet when this emergency coverage occurs for
verification needs.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
